@laanwj Any reason not to pull this (checking my open commits for progress currently)?

comments.body: This doesn't look correct. You shouldn't call MapPort at all if USE_UPNP is not set.

There are three settings for USE_PNP:
- `#undef USE_UPNP`: no libupnpc compiled in at all
- `#define USE_UPNP 0`: libupnp compiled in, but defaults to off
- `#define USE_UPNP 1`: libupnp compiled in, and defaults to on
We have an empty dummy function that is called if USE_UPNP is not set (in net.cpp).
If USE_UPNP is defined, we default to true, all other cases (even if no libupnpc was compiled in) should be false, IMO this should be working?

No - USE_UPNP can be defined and be either 0 or 1, depending on whether it should be enabled by default or not. So this should be:

``` c++
static const bool DEFAULT_UPNP = USE_UPNP;
```

Yeah, will change this then...

Edit: Changed!
